sec.p: The role of perceived behavioral control in TPB is the non-volitional elements, which can predict the behavioral intention. PBC comprises two separable components, self-efficacy and controllability, and can be considered a unitary latent variable in a hierarchical factor model [ 36]. In pro-environmental behavior studies, PBC and other TPB factors accounted for 95% of intentions with respect to conservation behaviors [ 37]. PBC was also one of the psychological factors that influenced energy-saving behaviors [ 15]. However, in a study on modes of travel, Tikir et al. [ 18] demonstrated that PBC was not a significant predictor of behavioral intentions. In line with the studies of Abrahamse et al. [ 15] and Lam [ 22], PBC was defined as the convenience of buying energy-efficient appliances for an individual in the ECC model.
